title: Leiden Clinical Prediction Rule for Undifferentiated Arthritis
description: Diagnoses rheumatoid arthritis in patients with recent-onset undifferentiated arthritis by predicting the likelihood of progression from undifferentiated arthritis to rheumatoid arthritis within one year

parameters.name: age_years
parameters.description: Patient age in years (multiplied by 0.02 in calculation)

parameters.name: tender_joints_count
parameters.description: Number of tender joints (out of 68 assessed joints)

parameters.name: swollen_joints_count
parameters.description: Number of swollen joints (out of 66 assessed joints)

parameters.name: anti_ccp_antibodies
parameters.description: Presence of anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) antibodies

result.name: leiden_prediction_score
result.description: Leiden Clinical Prediction Rule score for rheumatoid arthritis progression

ranges.description: Low risk of progression to rheumatoid arthritis
ranges.interpretation: Low likelihood of progression from undifferentiated arthritis to rheumatoid arthritis within one year. Conservative management with watchful waiting may be appropriate. Regular follow-up recommended to monitor for disease progression.

ranges.description: Indeterminate risk of progression to rheumatoid arthritis
ranges.interpretation: Intermediate likelihood of progression to rheumatoid arthritis. Clinical judgment and additional factors should guide treatment decisions. Consider close monitoring and potentially early intervention depending on patient characteristics and clinical presentation.

ranges.description: High risk of progression to rheumatoid arthritis
ranges.interpretation: High likelihood of progression from undifferentiated arthritis to rheumatoid arthritis within one year. Early initiation of disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) should be strongly considered to prevent joint damage and disability.

references: van der Helm-van Mil AHM, le Cessie S, van Dongen H, Breedveld FC, Toes REM, Huizinga TWJ. A prediction rule for disease outcome in patients with recent-onset undifferentiated arthritis: how to guide individual treatment decisions. Arthritis Rheum. 2007 Feb;56(2):433-40.

Kuriya B, Cheng CK, Chen HM, Bykerk VP. Validation of a prediction rule for development of rheumatoid arthritis in patients with early undifferentiated arthritis. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009 Sep;68(9):1482-5.

Tamai M, Kawakami A, Uetani M, Fukushima A, Arima K, Iwanaga N, et al. A prediction rule for disease outcome in patients with undifferentiated arthritis using magnetic resonance imaging of the wrists and finger joints and serologic autoantibodies. Arthritis Rheum. 2009 Oct 15;61(10):1324-31.
formula: Score = (Age × 0.02) + Sex points + Joint distribution points + Symmetric distribution points + Morning stiffness points + Tender joints points + Swollen joints points + CRP points + RF points + Anti-CCP points
notes: Developed from the Leiden Early Arthritis Clinic cohort study
Applies to adults with recent-onset undifferentiated arthritis (symptom duration <2 years)
Designed to predict progression to rheumatoid arthritis within 1 year
Score ranges from approximately 0 to 13 points
High specificity for identifying patients who will progress to RA
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and other diagnostic criteria
Age component calculated as: age in years × 0.02
Validated across multiple populations and clinical settings
Helps guide early treatment decisions with DMARDs
Not intended to replace comprehensive rheumatological evaluation
Most accurate when applied to patients with symptom duration <6 months
Consider serial assessments for patients in indeterminate risk category
